item.title: Rainbow Six Siege Y9S4 Patch Notes | Operation Collision Point
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/rainbow-six-siege-y9s4-patch-notes/

Rainbow Six Siege’s Y9S4 update drops today, with Ubisoft taking the game offline for up to 60 minutes to apply the super-sized patch. It ushers in Operation Collision Point, which brings a new Operator to the game, as well as a slew of new features, tweaks, and balances.

It’s the last major update of the year for Rainbow Six Siege – check out the Y9S4 patch notes below.

When Does Operation Collision Point Release?

Operation Collision Point is released today, December 3 on all platforms. It’s a free-to-consume update that brings countless new features and changes to the game, including:

  • Blackbeard, a new Attacker
  • Player Protection updates
  • Ballistic Shield balances
  • Console to PC crossplay 1.0
  • Matchmaking improvements

It’s a serious update that has players excited. This is typical of Ubisoft, though. Every so often, the team releases a major update into the Rainbow Six Siege ecosystem that alters the playing field – it’s why Siege has stayed on top for almost a decade.

Y9S4 Patch Size

Here are the download sizes for the Operation Collision Point update:

  • Ubisoft Connect: 73.99 GB
  • Steam: 14.8 GB
  • Xbox One: 34.4 GB
  • Xbox Series X: 40.7 GB
  • PlayStation 4: 39.90 GB
  • PlayStation 5: 36.74 GB

It was noted that the download sizes are larger than usual because the team has completed a texture reforge.

The Y9S4 patch is huge both in size and in what it offers. From an Operator price decrease to new seasonal skins, and hundreds of bug fixes to the introduction of the Siege Cup ecosystem, players are being spoilt rotten by Ubisoft this month.

Are you looking forward to Operation Collision Point? Let us know on the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Elden Ring 2 isn’t being made

item.title: 13 Games Are Leaving Xbox Game Pass in December
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/game-pass-games-december-leaving/

Xbox has announced that 13 different games will be leaving Xbox Game Pass this December.

The 13 games to leave Xbox Game Pass are:

Leaving December 15:

  • Amnesia: The Bunker (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • Forager (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • Forza Horizon 4 (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • Rainbow Billy: The Curse of the Leviathan (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • Rise of the Tomb Raider (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • Tin Hearts (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • The Quarry (Cloud and Console)

Leaving December 31:

  • BlazBlue: Cross Tag Battle (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • Close to the Sun (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • Humankind (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • Lego 2K Drive (Cloud and Console)
  • McPixel 3 (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • Party Animals (Cloud and Console)

Announced on June 25, 2024, Forza Horizon 4 is leaving stores and Xbox Game Pass on December 15. For more information, please visit the Forza blog.

Xbox has also announced all the games coming to Game Pass in December 2024, with a few announcements for games coming in January, too.

Which game will you be sad to see leave Game Pass this month? Let us know on the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the Lenovo Legion S leaks

item.title: Xbox Games Coming to Game Pass This December Revealed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/xbox-game-pass-games-december/

Xbox has revealed that the next batch of Game Pass games will be available for service in December.

Crash Team Racing Nitro-Fueled (Console) – December 4
Game Pass Ultimate, Game Pass Standard, Game Pass Core

Crash is back in the driver’s seat! Get ready to go fur-throttle with Crash Team Racing Nitro-Fueled. It’s the authentic CTR experience plus a whole lot more, now fully remastered and revved up to the max. Start your engines with the original game modes, characters, tracks, power-ups, weapons, and controls. It’s the CTR you love, now kicked into the highest gear.

Forza Motorsport (Xbox Series X|S) – December 4
Now with Game Pass Standard

Available with Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass and now coming to Game Pass Standard. Race over 500 real-world cars, including modern race cars and more than 100 cars new to Forza Motorsport. Make every lap count across 20 living environments, with fan-favorite locations and multiple track layouts to master. Each track features live on-track scoring, fully dynamic time-of-day with weather, and unique driving conditions that ensure no two laps ever look or play the same.

Hauntii (Console) – December 4
Now with Game Pass Standard

Play as a brave yet naive little ghost, Hauntii, and set off on a quest guided by enigmatic Eternians. Possess, solve puzzles, and shape your fate in this captivating adventure. The game’s hand-crafted art style blends line art and animation with a striking palette, creating a visually captivating experience.

Humanity (Console) – December 4
Now with Game Pass Standard

Become a Shiba Inu and help reconstruct humankind in the acclaimed action-puzzle game, Humanity. Drop commands to guide a mindless human horde to the goal through 90 increasingly challenging handcrafted story mode stages. Then, choose from thousands of user-made puzzles expanding on the breadth of mechanics, or design your own and share it with the community.

EA Sports WRC (Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X|S) EA Play – December 5
Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass

Build the car of your dreams and get unlimited access to EA Sports WRC, coming soon to Game Pass Ultimate and PC Game Pass via EA Play. Members can battle the elements across dirt, snow, and asphalt in the pursuit of the perfect run. Plus, save 10% on EA digital purchases, including the WRC 24 Season Expansion.

Overthrown (Game Preview) (Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X|S) – December 5
Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass

Available on day one! Lift and throw anything as you build and manage your kingdom in this chaotic city builder with up-to 6-player co-op. Harness the power of your soul-stealing crown to partake in anime-style combat, farm the land, gather resources, and much more

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle (Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X|S) – December 9
Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass

Available on day one! Uncover one of history’s greatest mysteries in Indiana Jones and the Great Circle, a first-person, single-player adventure set between the events of “Raiders of the Lost Ark” and “The Last Crusade”. The year is 1937, sinister forces are scouring the globe for the secret to an ancient power connected to the Great Circle, and only one person can stop them – Indiana Jones. Pre-install now to unravel the mystery on day one.

Wildfrost (Cloud, Console, and PC) – December 10
Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass

Take on the elements in Wildfrost, a tactical rogue-like deck builder! Journey across a frozen tundra, collecting cards strong enough to banish the eternal winter.

Also announced were a few games for January 2025:

Carrion (Cloud, Console, and PC) – January 2
Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass, Game Pass Standard

Making a return to the Game Pass library, Carrion is a reverse horror game in which you assume the role of an amorphous creature of unknown origin. Stalk and consume those that imprisoned you to spread fear and panic throughout the facility. Grow and evolve as you tear down this prison and acquire more and more devastating abilities on the path to retribution. 

Road 96 (Cloud, Console, and PC) – January 7
Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass, Game Pass Standard

Returning to the Game Pass library, Road 96 is a crazy, beautiful road-trip. On this risky road trip to the border, you’ll meet incredible characters and discover their intertwined stories and secrets in an ever-evolving adventure. But every mile opens a choice to make. Your decisions will change your adventure, change the people you meet, and maybe even change the world.

What do you think of the games coming to Xbox Game Pass in December? Let us know on the Insider Gaming forum.

item.title: When is Spotify Wrapped 2024 Coming Out?
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/when-is-spotify-wrapped-2024-coming-out/

Spotify Wrapped is one of the most exciting times of the year for the 250 million subscribers to the music streaming service. It doesn’t matter if you use it to play background noises while gaming or if you rely on it solely on your commute, everyone waits all year round for Spotify Wrapped to drop.

With that being said, Spotify has kept a tight wrapper around this year’s release, refusing to give anything away on social media. When is Spotify Wrapped 2024 coming out, and where can you find it when it does?

Where is Spotify Wrapped 2024?

Spotify Wrapped first surfaced in 2016 as the platform’s attempt to sum up everyone’s listening habits for the past 12 months. It has evolved with time and has become much more granular, and it’s now a staple in the calendar of every subscriber worldwide.

With Spotify Wrapped, you’re given unique insights into the music that defined your year. You’ll be offered an audio-visual trip down memory lane and a playlist tailored exclusively to you.

That’s all well and good, but when is Spotify Wrapped 2024 coming out?

Spotify Wrapped has always dropped around the first week of December, so we can expect it to arrive in the coming days (at the time of publishing). Here’s a brief history:

  • 2023: November 29
  • 2022: November 30
  • 2021: December 1
  • 2020: December 2
  • 2019: December 5
  • 2018: December 6
  • 2017: December 6

Potentially, we’re looking at a release date of December 4 for Spotify Wrapped 2024.

To find it, you’ll just need to log into the Spotify app on a mobile or desktop device and you’ll be presented with a pop-up alerting you that your Spotify Wrapped 2024 breakdown is ready. Then, you’ll have a 2024 lookback playlist contained in your ‘Made For You’ section on the app.

Are you looking forward to unlocking your end-of-year report from Spotify? Let us know on the Insider Gaming forum what you’re expecting in your Spotify Wrapped.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the news that Switch 2 screen protectors have been spotted on sale

item.title: What Happened To A-Life 2.0 In STALKER 2? GSC Explains Everything
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/what-happened-a-life-2-0-in-stalker-2/

When STALKER 2 was released on November 20, one thing that was missing was the ‘A-Life 2.0’ that was promised to make The Zone a living, breathing world. It was said that A-Life 2.0 would serve as a solid evolution of the A-Life mechanics featured in the earlier STALKER games, giving players a sense of being present in a world populated by intelligent AI characters.

That’s not there in STALKER 2, and recently, GSC removed a reference to A-Life 2.0 from the game’s listing on Steam. However, GSC’s CEO has sat down with IGN to explain what happened to A-Life 2.0 and why it’s not in STALKER 2.

Where Did A-Life 2.0 Go?

In an interview with IGN, Ievgen Grygorovych, the CEO of GSC Game World, explained what happened to A-Life 2.0. It was penned as being one of the most advanced features in STALKER 2, allowing players to witness events unfolding independently of their input, with NPCs almost living their own lives irrespective of what the player was doing.

Grygorovych said:

This system to work properly requires a much larger area for spawn NPCs, and it requires much more memory resources. We were fighting with optimization. To optimize, you have a lot of things that need your resources, and you try to cut things from different directions to properly optimize the game well.

But to make it work we had to optimize some things, and they make A-Life work in many situations not as it should. Also, we created some bugs not long ago before release with NPCs spawning in the air and dropping back to the bottom. They should actually spawn in the terrain. Why it happened, I don’t know! And also we had some bugs with AI behavior.

He explained that the team is working very hard to stabilise A-Life 2.0 and deliver what was promised, but it’s ‘very broken and not working’. In another statement, GSC’s creative director, Maria Grygorovych, threw the blame at the company’s marketing team, stressing it was them who removed the reference to A-Life 2.0 on Steam without permission.

She brought receipts, though. In the interview with IGN, she showed screenshots of a conversation between her and the ‘marketing person’ who removed the details on Steam. However, the team won’t put the reference back until they’ve fixed A-Life 2.0.

That’s what happened – but it’s now up to GSC to patch up A-Life 2.0 and turn it into something that resembles what was promised.

Are you playing STALKER 2? Let us know on the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that PlayStation is hosting special esports tournaments on PS5

item.title: What is Vulture Aid Perk in Black Ops 6 Zombies?
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/vulture-aid-perk-zombies-black-ops-6/

Black Ops 6 has reignited Zombies as the mode returned back to its round-based roots. The undead mode has been all about giving the community what they want, a classic Zombies experience, with all the Perks and features fans know and love.

Speaking of Perks, you’ll find a familiar bunch in both Terminus and Liberty Falls, from Juggernog, Speedcola and Quick Revive to Deadshot Daiquiri, Stamina-Up and PHD Flopper. With the new Citadelle des Morts map, the devs have decided to reintroduce a Perk from Black Ops 2 called Vulture Aid.

For those who aren’t familiar with the Perk, here’s what Vulturue Aid is in Black Ops 6 Zombies and how it works.

  • What is Vulture Aid in BO6 Zombies?
  • Vulture Aid Perk effects
  • Where is Vulture Aid Perk in Black Ops 6 Zombies?

What is Vulture Aid in BO6 Zombies?

Vulture Aid is a Zombies Perk that players can purchase in the Black Ops 6 Citadelle des Morts map, which arrives December 5, 2024, as part of the Season 1 Reloaded update.

The Vulture Aid Perk was first introduced in Black Ops 2’s Buried map and hasn’t been seen since. It returns in Black Ops 6, and it will likely feature the same coffin-style red and white Perk machine design.

Vulture Aid Perk effects

  • See Perks, wall weapons, the Pack-a-Punch machine, and the Mystery Box through walls when close-by (they will also have a brighter glow for better visability).
  • Zombies also occasionally drop ammo or points on death
  • Some Zombies will release a green cloud upon death that players can walk into to mask themselves from Zombies and be ignored.

These are the effects of Vulture Aid in Black Ops 2. There’s no telling whether the Perk will have the same effects in Black Ops 6 until mwe get hands on, but it will likely be very similar.

Where is Vulture Aid Perk in Black Ops 6 Zombies?

Venture Aid is on the Citadelle des Morts map in Black Ops 6 Zombies. We don’t yet know exactly where the Perk Machine will be, but it has been confirmed for the new map.

Will you be picking up Venture Aid on the new Black Ops 6 Zombies map? Let us know by leaving a comment in the forum.

If you’re eager to read more about Black Ops 6, check out how to score Point Blank kills in Zombies and what to do with Loot Keys.
